More Notes: Percentage of short-run effects of extreme heat exposure on TFP offset by longer-run adaptation.
Mitigation of short-run impacts of extreme heat exposure on China’s agricultural TFPs.
Offset of short-run effect on yield in the long run.
Agricultural TFP is expected to decrease linearly by 2.6% with an additional one-day cumulative exposure to temperatures above 33°C during the whole year.

Estimated decrease in agricultural yield due to an additional one-day cumulative exposure to temperatures above 33°C during the year. Relative to impacts on TFP, this extreme heating has a 71% larger negative impact on yield.
Impact of adaptation on offsetting short-run effects of extreme heat on China's agriculture yield.
Impact of adaptation on offsetting short-run effects of extreme heat on China's agricultural TFP.
Long-run impact of extreme heating on agricultural yield. 2.3% reduction in yield expected with one-day cumulative exposure to temperatures above 33°C.
Mitigation of short-run effects in TFP due to adaptation. CI represents 95% confidence interval.
Percentage of short-run yield effects offset by long-run adaptations.  95% Confidence Interval given for low and high values.

Calculated as (1-β_2LD/β_2FE) * 100%, where β_2LD and β_2FE are coefficients from long-difference and fixed-effects regressions, respectively, for GDD above a threshold. Represents the percentage of short-run impact offset by adaptation (Yield).
